website_summaries.verdict: A plunger that works well on low-flow toilets and those with elongated openings.
pros: Bulb design fits well into most toilets – even ones with odd shaped openings
Handle end gives good grip without hurting your hand
cons: Some users report the bulb getting stuck in the down position and splashing when it releases

customer_reviews.title: Does not properly seal my Kohler (see picture).
customer_reviews.text: The product description claims it "FITS ALL TOILETS including: Kohler", but it does not fit my Kohler. If you are trying to plunge a Kohler with the drain shape shown in the picture, do not get this plunger. No matter what angle I plunged at, the unit would not fully seal against the notch shown at the bottom of the picture (front of the toilet). It came closer to working than most plungers, but close isn't good enough. Fluid just spurted from the uncovered notch. I am still looking for a plunger that will work.
customer_reviews.author: ken wells

customer_reviews.title: rendering the plunger useless since it would not form a seal
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit a Glacier Bay handicap toilet. The hollow steel handle broke thru the rubber, rendering the plunger useless since it would not form a seal. Also, the filthy toilet water came up thru the hollow handle, and when I tipped the plunger sideways, it came out the top of the handle. Yuck! It did not get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Rosekat4

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the worst plunger I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Like other negative reviews here, I found that this plunger doesn't form a good seal. It doesn't remove clogs any better than any other plunger I've used, but it DOES splash out much more water than any other.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopper; Occasional Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit my elongated toilet
customer_reviews.text: They boldly claim that this fits all toilets, including elongated toilets. Unfortunately, it does not. I have a Caroma Smart elongated toilet and this plunger does not fit. It will not seal. It just folds in on itself and splashes toilet water all over. I will be returning this product. My search continues for a plunger for an elongated toilet :(
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best plunger ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best plunger ever. I am in the unfortunate position to have to use a toilet that gets clogged every single time I go #2. With my previous plungers sometimes I would have to plunge and plunge and plunge, sometimes for up to 15 minutes before I could get the clog cleared. Once I even had to use an auger. But with this plunger, all I have to do is a few pumps, and it's done in less than a minute. It has made my life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: acosmichippo

customer_reviews.title: **Not Universal**  doesn’t work with low water-use toilet
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be universal, and many reviews said it was the only one that worked for their low-water use toilet. On the first occasion I had to use it, five days after the return window closed, I found that it’s no better than any other plunger. I got charged equally as much for the unique shaped holder, meaning I’m out $28 for something that is useless. On top of that, I still have a clogged toilet and toilet water all over my shoes and legs. Thanks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Worst plunger I've ever used...
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the plunger collapses, whenever you try to plunge the toilet.... EVERY TIME! Also, it has an inner 'lip' that catches a lot of what you're plunging (I won't go into detail because it's disgusting). Whenever you try to empty said grossness, it won't all come out, resulting in a disgusting mess. I'm headed to the store to buy an 'old school' plunger. I'm sick and tired of trying to make this useless. junk work.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work well for us, whereas our more standard plunger continues to work well. (This was a second plunger that we purchased for our downstairs bathroom.) We have one gallon per flush toilets. I guess it may work well on some toilets - I can't say, because I don't know - but it didn't work well for us.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: This plunger works great in Toto toilets!
customer_reviews.text: I had to remove a very serious and solid clog from the TOTO Aquia IV in my rental property. This plunger works great in this application. After successfully pushing the clog down the line and into the sewer, I easily rinsed the nasty beehive in a five gallon bucket and poured the bucket thru the toilet to clean the bowl. I left the plunger with my tenant and ordered two more for my own homes, which are totally Toto, too.
customer_reviews.author: P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Toilet Water Flows Up Through the Handle to Your Hands - Very Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: I used this plunger once; A lot of Water from the toilet and it's other contents are sucked up through the hollow handle into your hands during plunging (no splashing occurred). After storing, the water remains in the handle and then comes out again when you pick up the plunger even days later. I did not enjoy getting my hands full of stuff from my toilet. Handle is flimsy. I do not recommend this plunger to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ekstein

customer_reviews.title: Korky 99 USE 4 Plugged up Toilets. Better than old Standard Plungers
customer_reviews.text: After a Plugged Toilet that I was unable to Unplug with the Usual old Plunger, I had to call a Favorite Plumbing Company. He had the Korky. He only used the Korky to Unplug & Drain the Toilet. Hooray! He says it always works for him. He seldom has to use a "Snake" So I inquired what it was called, where to get it. He advised that I purchase it at Amazon. Am relieved to have it here at home in case of another emergency Plug up of Toilet. The older usual Plunger could not make a good enough Seal in/on Below the Bowl on the Twisty Toilet Drain. A good product, KORKY 99
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Works great, if you pull down the lip on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: We got this with the holder, and it arrived with no instructions, with the bottom lip of the plunger folded up inside it. This folding makes it fit in the holder better, but makes it pretty useless as a toilet plunger. I immediately pulled down the lip so it would fit the toilet opening, and it still fits in the holder pretty well. But most importantly, it works really well with that lip down, better than the stiff plastic "accordion" plungers I've used for years. Both types move the amount of water needed to be effective (unlike most plungers), but his one being rubber, fits the opening much better. I'm ordering a second one.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: The Korky 99-4A Beehive Max Universal unclogs my small toilet
customer_reviews.text: When I remodeled my bathroom, the local building code mandated I use a high-efficiency toilet (HET). None of the standard plungers worked because of the toilet's small triangle shape. I bought a Neiko 60166A plunger that was advertised to work on a HET. It didn't work. I had to buy a snake to clear my toilet which was a messy operation. The last time the HET clogged I tried the Korky 99-4A Beehive Max Universal. It unclogged the HET with just a couple of ups-and-downs. It's always nice to find a product advertised to solve a difficult problem and does it. My daughter-in-law will be thrilled when she opens her birthday present next week.
customer_reviews.author: Flash2520

customer_reviews.title: Not the answer
customer_reviews.text: It’s really no better or worse than the normal useless ones the big boxes sell. I’m kind of appalled, if you will, that nobody has figured out a decent plunger for the oval drain toilets. Come on, how tough can it be? I think part of the problem is the correct design is not going to sit flat on the floor, so it’s going to have to have a hanging container. ?..who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: NOT hfor elongated toilet holes
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known about elongated holes in newer toilets when we had to replace our old one. We had to purchase a custom size and I was mostly concerned with getting the tallest height I could get, so I missed the whole hole thing. 😳 At any rate, this was rated as high as the sky for newfangled toilets, and perhaps the 5-star raters don't know what is meant by "elongated." We're still looking.
customer_reviews.author: voracious reader

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit all toilets.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It has a nice appearance. Doesn’t look terrible in a bathroom. Cons: it doesn’t work for “all” toilets. It wouldn’t make a seal on my toilet, and was therefore useless.
customer_reviews.author: Luke C

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for splash!
customer_reviews.text: Careful when you use this to plunge ‘nasty’ clogged toilets. This does seal the opening and clears the clog, but not without giving a ‘nasty’ splash back with every plunge. I have to give pressure because it doesn’t plunge itself, but when the rubber walls up as the center goes down, ‘nasty’ water pools in and around the whole radius of it. So be ever so careful pulling it back up to push down again. You’ll get tagged by liquid turds if you aren’t paying attention. At the very least though, you’ll be wiping something off that got hit. Ewww
customer_reviews.author: Jheezy

customer_reviews.title: Absolute piece of Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and used it for first time. It's a total joke. In Kohler toilet it just splashes water every where! Its flimsy, waste and water stays inside of plunger. I cannot tell you what and absolute rip off this one is. I don't normally leave reviews, but after making a mess of our bathroom, and buying this based on the description provided, it is the biggest joke of product I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: has a mind-boggling stupid design. It splits at the base and is ...
customer_reviews.text: The plunger itself works well. The holder on the other hand, has a mind-boggling stupid design. It splits at the base and is incredibly difficult to re-attach together once it comes apart. Ridiculous. Edit: After 2 years the compress action is starting to stick so instead of expanding smoothly, it jumps causing water to splash out. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CookieFactory

customer_reviews.title: this thing just saved my day
customer_reviews.text: ok, a few days ago i took a hard poo and it clogged my toilet. i know i needed something strong and didn't trust the local mom and pop stores so i googled what would be the best plunger and this came up. it took a few more hard suctions than i expected but it got the job done. knocked off a star because it took a few efforts to clear the clog when its advertised it doesn't take much effort and bc the package says "no splash" and yes it does splash because it suctions so hard that it splashes when you pull up.
customer_reviews.author: Ravyn

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST PLUNGER (PERIOD). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write many reviews but this plunger impressed me so much that I had to write one. I have owned at least ten plungers through the years. This Korky Plunger includes all the missing features of all the plungers before it. The bulbous shape, which prevents splash backs, makes it more effective across different toilet bowl shapes and sizes. The rubber is sturdy yet supple enough to squeeze into the bowl. The T handle makes it very easy to use, especially for providing proper leverage when “pulsing” up and down. Shipping was very fast. It was delivered at least two days before the promised date.
customer_reviews.author: JCabrera

customer_reviews.title: Best plunger ever!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a house with 5 men and this plunger is a miracle worker! Just a few days ago, my mother in law was struggling on an impossible clog and suffering with a regular plunger. She was complaining that the hole in the toilet has a weird shape and no plungers work on it. I brought this one to her, and it was unclogged in a mere couple of minutes. If you have "weird shaped" toilets, men in your house, or if you are a human and use bathrooms, this is the plunger for you!! I will be buying more once I get my own house, and will be recommending this one to everyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie DiBona

customer_reviews.title: Worked the First Time
customer_reviews.text: My brother dropped a load that plugged up my toilet. I tried everything from an old school plunger to drain cleaner and nothing worked. As a last ditch effort before calling a plumber to snake the line, I decided to try this beehive. I was skeptical to say the least, but it worked on about the 20th plunge. The line cleared and the blockage was gone. BTW, I have a newer Sterling brand toilet with the oblong hole.
customer_reviews.author: richyp

customer_reviews.title: Fills with Sh-T
customer_reviews.text: The product is so poorly designed that once I used it to clear a toilet and it was impossible to remove the crap from inside the plunger. It's just too soft and too bulky. You'd need to take it to a pail and plunge it a few times to clean it. Completely impractical. I would have returned it but I couldn't get the sh-t out of it.
customer_reviews.author: DOGSBODY

customer_reviews.title: BEST Plunger ... EVER
customer_reviews.text: For years I have used the traditional type of plunger with moderate success on most things and epic fail on some. Very frustrating. Have snaked some drains but that is a last resort and quite nasty. I saw THIS plunger on Amazon and figured it was worth a shot especially because our relatively new Toto toilet (which is legendary at hardly ever clogging) does not have a shape that allows normal plungers to seal well. THIS ONE DOES!!!!!! It is also VERY powerful with whatever effort you apply. I tell everyone about this plunger! Yay!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Viking54

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on other plungers until you've tried this one first
customer_reviews.text: I've tried so many plungers over the years that having to use one has become an exercise in frustration.Until now. Wish I had started with the Beehive Max. I have a bunch of toilets that are all a little different but this plunger easily seals non-round openings at various angles and clears clogs in no time. I'm using thisas a plunger holder and it fits.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: great plunger; bad holder
customer_reviews.text: the plunger is great: sturdy, well constructed, effective, and easy to use. it is better than traditionally shaped plungers; creates less splash and has no slip potential. the holder does not fit the plunger. the opening is relatively so tight, that it takes two hands to put it in and take it out. i have to hold the holder to wrench it out and to stuff it back in, and i never want my hands that close or directly touching anything other than the plunger's handle. it's very awkward.
customer_reviews.author: arb

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it. It works.
customer_reviews.text: I had a very stubborn toilet clog. I used a regular toilet plunger, a closet snake, and buckets of hot water. Totally frustrated, I ordered the Beehive Max from Amazon and received it two days. With fingers crossed I seated it in the toilet and pushed once. Once! The clog cleared immediately. Now, the other things I had tried, plus sitting for two days, might have loosened that clog up a bit, but the Beehive applied the coup de gras. It's one of those tools that I wish I had heard of 40 years ago. It's worth every penny of its price.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Engineer in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype, it's just another plunger
customer_reviews.text: Does not seal with the toilet I got at costco, so does not perform as described. Also feels cheap and flimsy, the holder is so lightweight, it's hard to extract or insert the plunger into the holder with the holder moving all around.
customer_reviews.author: Just some person on the internet

customer_reviews.title: Size and Shape Gets The Job Done!
customer_reviews.text: I had a toilet in my new place that has been driving me nuts by not flushing properly. I felt all along that something was blocking the pipe. Used a traditional plunger over and over many times. Tried both enzyme and acid drain cleaners (not at the same time) with no luck. Got the new plunger today and the beehive shape made for a good seal I could not get with the other , and the large bellow size made for excellent force. Cleared that sucker with 4 good pushes. Give this one a try if you need a plunger, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Look... Just buy It
customer_reviews.text: This was the 4th plunger we bought over a 2 year period, and hands down this is the best one we own. It's nice that it is adjustable, but what really matters to me is the suction and it does the job. I've spent 20+ minutes plunging with other plungers each "incident" over the years, but with this Korky it has been a breeze. Take it from someone who has wasted a lot of money on cheaper or more aesthetically pleasing plungers, this is the one you want/need to buy.
customer_reviews.author: MiriamEnergy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome plunger!
customer_reviews.text: My toilets stopped working correctly just after the hurricane passed. It never hit us and just rain. Then a couple of days later the trouble started. I used the old fashion plunger and it worked a little bit it kept backing up. This plumber arrived today and worked wonders so far. I'm going on 69 and been a widow nearly 12 years... small frame and was able to work it. Ordered another for the second bathroom. A hugh thank you to the seller and maker! My toilets are standard... hope this helps pthers.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Drew fan

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best plunger  known to man
customer_reviews.text: Have bought over the years a couple for my own home as well as given them as gifts. Everyone I know who has tried this has said that this plunger really works. It somehow makes a better seal and allows for pushing and pulling those tough clogs that other plungers just can't do. I tossed out the old plungers we had before as there was simply no way I would ever use those over this. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: matt1234

customer_reviews.title: Does EXACTLY what it came to do!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a lady not a plumber! This thing works and it only took less than 5 minutes to clear the drain. I used Charmin (almost impossible to find Scotts these days) and it it clogged my toilet like nobody's business. I tried my standard Food Lion plunger...NO LUCK. Off to google...in goes the dish washing liquid, hot water, and vinegar...NO LUCK. Off to Amazon...the reviews are accurate. It doesnt take much to get things moving. Simple design...nothing fancy. GETS THE JOB DONE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon-aholic

customer_reviews.title: Plunger great - Holder cheesy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second plunger of this type and I would give it 5 stars. It has never failed me once. However, I ordered the accompanying holder because of the exposure in this particular bathroom. It's cheap white plastic and may be worth an additional $3 but to charge an extra $11 for this thing is ludicrous. (plus which, I ordered on Monday - when I went to review, Amazon had dropped the price by $3.04 - grrrrr!)
customer_reviews.author: Eeyore

customer_reviews.title: Makes Quick Work of Clogs
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old has been clogging the toilets in the house recently, and none of the plungers we had worked. I was getting tired of spending hours unclogging them, so I did what people do and did a quick internet search for best toilet plunger, and came up with this one at the top of multiple lists. So I risked it and ordered it. It has been great. The handle makes it easy to use. The design makes it create a tight seal on any of our toilets. I never thought I'd take the time to write a review for a plunger, but this one is so great, I just had to.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Works Well without a lot of pressure!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this in January when I had a problem and the regular plunger made it next to impossible to unplug. The new toilets make it almost impossible to get something unplugged with older plungers. My return window has closed and I still hadn’t had the opportunity to use this new plunger. Yesterday, the occasion arose and this plunger worked wonderfully. I don’t have a lot of strength, So was pleasantly surprised that it worked so well without all the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Dubearry

customer_reviews.title: A couple of pushes is all it takes!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is magical. We have Sterling 1.6 gallon toilets with almost square shaped holes that render regular plungers useless. Add to the fact I have two young boys that use several rolls of toilet paper at a time. That equals lots of clogs. And a lot of pushing. Not anymore! First of all it has a fantastic handle, especially the grip on the top where you can really get your hand around it. But you don't need that much force, because this thing is so well designed that it creates tremendous force and after a couple of pushes, the toughest of clogs swirl away.
customer_reviews.author: FamilyofNerds

customer_reviews.title: Fixed the problem
customer_reviews.text: I had a stubborn toilet stoppage which shut down bathroom for a few days. Have no idea what was causing problem, but this plunger worked where my old, tried-and-true plunger failed. We have newer toilets and the beehive fit just fine. I filled bell with water and started gently pushing handle in and out. It took about 6-8 pumps to unplug toilet. The main difference I find between this product and other plungers used (aside from the look of the bell) is the strong memory it has and ease it retracted back to form when pulling handle back. Just ordered another for upstairs bathroom Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name Here

customer_reviews.title: No Need For A Plumber
customer_reviews.text: Most people don't need a toilet plunger often, but when they do it beats calling a plumber. This plunger is the best one that I could find on Amazon. It works great and it's a good value for the cost! Lots of water pressure is pushed through the drain with no splash back. The rubber is pliable and the handle design allows for easy use. I used it on our Kohler toilet. And...it's MADE IN THE USA. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Horse

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a plunger that works!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing multiple plungers from local stores and my problems not getting solved, I took to the internet for help. I have 4 children and things are constantly being flushed down the toilet bowl. I kept having this issue with other plungers turning inside out and trapping water and spent long periods of time trying to clear blockages. I saw this one and checked out some reviews and crossed my fingers that it would do the job. Best decision I've ever made. This plunger suctions well and clears clogs within only a couple pumps. I'm extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KayyCo

customer_reviews.title: Worked immediately
customer_reviews.text: Since I got a new low-water toilet, I have had occasional clogs and have a hard time clearing them with my old-fashioned plunger because of the odd shape of the hole in the toilet. Someone recommended I get a snake, so I was searching for a snake. I read a review of a snake that said it didn't work but this plunger did. So I ordered the plunger, got it the next day, and opened the clog with only three or four plunges. I'm so happy I read that recommendation in a review for another product as I was going to spend a lot more money when this works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Ammann (Lillie)

customer_reviews.title: Only Plunger that Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different plungers over the years--and this is the ONLY plunger that works on our three-year old Kohler toilets! This is the second one I have bought. No more expensive plumber calls! Strongly recommend that you order the MAXClean Universal Plunger Holder Drip Tray with this plunger to keep your floor dry. P.S. I have no idea what the "Sheerness" feature is supposed to be in the ratings.
customer_reviews.author: A. A. Brogowicz

customer_reviews.title: Great plunger! Trust the other reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Many 1.6 gallon/flush toilets require multiple flushes. We had our toilets replaced with one of the Toto models, which flushes very well with 1.6 gallons. However, sometimes, we do clog the toilet (don't ask...). Typical plungers get splashy, and require massive efforts. Based on the various reviews, I bought this to handle the occassional "overenthusiasm with toilet paper" or with "large #2's" (or both). This plunger works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Hy D. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Does no work!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this plunger. I fell for the description. I also made the mistake off throwing out my old plunger and had to retrieve it from the trash after trying to clear a clog twelve (12) times. The old fashioned one retrieved from the trash worked in three plunges.
customer_reviews.author: Bklyn Gal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed with this item at all, if there’s water still in the toilet, because the plunger is bulbous, it makes the water come up over the rim, that’s a situation I don’t want, have tried it twice, same issue, I’m done, back to the older style one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plunger is hard to fit been inside after each use
customer_reviews.text: The plunger works well and easily uncloggs. But it has difficulty fitting back in its compartment. You have to use your hands and maneuver it to fit been inside or it tilts.
customer_reviews.author: hkopinions

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the most effective plunger I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Korly-99-4A and had a use for it the day it arrived. Imagine my surprise when it pulled up what the plumber's snake was unable to get! I finally have a free flowing flush! I am so thrilled. I have a Toto toilet and nothing else seemed to fit it well enough to get the suction needed but this blessed Korky. Thank you for selling such a grand plunger. I made more than my day.....
customer_reviews.author: Anne B.

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for wasting my time and lying to me. Does not work on any toilet. It does not work on my brand new Kohler. Not happy with you people for saying it would work and I'm not happy with the idiots who designed toilets where a plunger won't work on them. Is it really that hard?!
customer_reviews.author: Troy@Protekt

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved!!! It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I want to write this with you in case you are in the same situation I was in. It was a Sunday and toilet clogged. I have the old-style toilet pump on hand. I pumped and pumped to no avail. That Sunday i ordered this bad boy. I continued pumping with my old pumper Sunday Monday and Tuesday morning. This pump arrived Tuesday by noon. Within 5 pumps, wallaw! my problem was solved. Five pumps! That's it, five. Buy it, it works.
customer_reviews.author: HustonX

customer_reviews.title: This cleared its first clog yesterday with 2 easy plunges.
customer_reviews.text: This cleared its first clog yesterday with 2 easy plunges...compared to the usual half hour with the old style plunger we used up to now. It rinsed off easily in the resulting clean toilet water and didn't even drip on the seat when I took it out. It filled in the long trough-like hole of our water efficient toilet and made a perfect seal. I couldn't believe I spent $14 for a plunger....but it was more than worth it! I especially like the plastic T shaped handle that made it comfortable to use. Love this plunger!
customer_reviews.author: B Ba

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and weak
customer_reviews.text: Terrible plunger, very flimsy and weak, this is something a 3 yr old could use for pretend. It’s like paper
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Digital

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for first use. Second time using it the plunger got distorted and now gets stuck in an inverted manner. Doesn't go back to normal shape unless you use your hands to reshape...and that's not something you really want to do when it's "messy".
customer_reviews.author: JP Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worked
customer_reviews.text: Low flow toilets require a good plunger every so often. I needed to replace the one I've had for forty years and took a leap of faith that this one would do the job. (Toto elongated bowl) The plunger was flexible and at the correct angle and a dozen pumps the obstruction cleared. I did cover a nearby shower drain to increase pressure which seemed to help. My plumber said this is common so before calling him I researched an upgraded plunger. I'll buy another for downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: did not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: could not get this to make a substantial "plunge". tried filling it with water as advised. tried different positions. could not get sufficient leverage to drive the water through the toilet. returned
customer_reviews.author: W. Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Very good plunger
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this plunger as it is very effective unclogging the toilet, which is, after all, the reason I bought it. I recently purchased a Gerber Avalanche toilet, (which I do not like, btw) and it clogs constantly. To make matters worse, it was extremely difficult to unclog and my old plunger, (which worked great on my old toilet) did not work on the new toilet, and made a mess, everywhere. The Korky does a great job. My ONLY complaint is that it stays in the "down" position when you first use it, which is a little messy sometimes, but it still works, even in that position, and as I said, is quite effective.
customer_reviews.author: E to the J

customer_reviews.title: Big, bulky and kinda ugly but gets the job done everytime.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. Has not failed me since I’ve bought. This should be your choice if your toilet has anything other than a circular drain. Works perfect. Kinda pricey but you get what you pay for. It is rather big and bulky so it’s harder to hide. Just keep it hidden in a shed or utility closet till you need it. I just kept in a spare bathroom in the guest room.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Gil

customer_reviews.title: Base is just hard to use but the plunger works fine
customer_reviews.text: The plunger it self works just fine and should be able to unclog just about anything although it's fairly large footprint and will need a bit more floor space than most other plungers for the home. While it keeps the plunger out of the way and dry, the base is a bit cumbersome and getting the plunger in and out requires a bit more manipulation than I would prefer - it's too snug and you almost have to use both hands to pull it out, yuck.
customer_reviews.author: WASTELAND RAVENTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing really works! We have a Toto toilet, which rarely clogs but has the elongated drain that other plungers just don't fit. We also have an old toilet that clogs regularly and I can't wait to replace with a Toto. This plunger works great with both of them. It actually seals enough to create some suction, so the clog goes down with only one or two plunges. The other plungers I've used don't do that. I'm going to buy another Korky so we have one in each bathroom, and throw the old ones away!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Finally a plunger that works for our keyhole type toilet!
customer_reviews.text: This is soooooo......great for keyhole shaped toilet openings. We have quite a collection of plungers that could not do the job because they couldn't cover the opening well enough., This was an answer to a prayer. The handle shape is a terrific asset too. No more sore hands. The soft rubber flexes easily. Watch out for a little splashing until the bulb fills with water when you first start. Thank you Mr. Korky! P.S. We have a Kholer toilet if that makes any difference. We bought it because we saw that people recommended it for Kholer toilets. They were right!
customer_reviews.author: Gone Girl

customer_reviews.title: Well designed plunger
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble with slow toilet. I got the Korky. I sat it in the corner by the toilet. All of a sudden, no trouble. Humm. So I didn't use it for months. Finally slow toilet again. It's great. It is the only one I have had that really works, and doesn't leave black or any stain. The T handle makes it easier to work. Also, the white handle makes it look clean and nice enough to sit by the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Henry

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Took care of a problem that no other method could solve. Must-have item for every household. Keep one in guest bathroom and spare your guests the possible embarrassment.
customer_reviews.author: Pam K.

customer_reviews.title: one of the best plungers i have ever used
customer_reviews.text: after looking around for a Plunger while seeing this one that wasn't sure how well this one was going to work for me but after given it a try and seeing it work right away that couldn't believe my eyes for finding a product that worked with my toilet after i couldn't find one before but nice product and would buy again
customer_reviews.author: thebite

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders
customer_reviews.text: Had to cancel my order from Amazon because my problem could not wait a week to be resolved. Bought this model from local hardware store and did the trick very well. I went about clearing all drains in the house. Make sure you use duct tape to cover the air holes before you tackle the drains. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GB-NH

customer_reviews.title: This works great for my non circular elongated toilet.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing much better than the old standby we grew up with. I bought an accordion style plunger and it was worse than the standard plunger. This thing really works though. You can feel the solid connection it makes and you hear the woosh of some serious water pressure. It works amazingly well!
customer_reviews.author: HiFideliTea

customer_reviews.title: Had an unwanted splash back
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once, so i can't speak to much about it other than a splash coming straight up the handle a couple of feet. It seems better built than what I've used before, but I really don't care for that splash. I didn't have a similar problem with my previous plunger that was one of the wide accordion-bellows type. This does seem like it will last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! Don't waste time with other plungers!
customer_reviews.text: Literally every time I use it; it clears the blockage with a single thrust. It creates an impeccable seal and gets the job done. I now feel like I've wasted so many hours of my life fighting a toilet clog with a sub-par plunger. This is like the excalibur of plungers, except you don't have to King Arthur to claim it for yourself. It's affordable, and it will be the last plunger you ever buy! (note: I purchased the stand for it as well; this one I would not recommend. It is difficult to get in and out of the stand, which is actually just a light and cheap plastic housing)
customer_reviews.author: Kilgannon

customer_reviews.title: Best I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I don't get the rated features listed, they don't make sense for a plunger. It is easy to push the air out and fill it with water, the most important feature. The next thing is you can direct the flow toward the clog instead of just straight down. Third, no bubbles or blow by causing splashing. How nice is that!!! The plastic handle doesn't soak up poop water as wood does and even the rubber is slick and cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: miragedsl

customer_reviews.title: A.M.A.Z.I.N.G.
customer_reviews.text: There was no backwash, no bubbles, no free-swimming anything while I plunged my clogged toilet with this wonder. The oval shape truly makes a difference, although I think the strength of the flange and size of the plunger also has something to do with it's success at sealing to effectively plunge. Highly recommended. As an Occupational Therapist, my only suggestion would be to widen the T-handle to accommodate 2 hands for those with limited upper body strength. It did not take much strength as an average adult, but I could see some of my clients having difficulty with it, and they could be independent with it if they could use 2 hands.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Wood

customer_reviews.title: Careful, it holds water
customer_reviews.text: This product has great suction as advertised. However, be careful when extracting from the toilet as accumulated water might be trapped within and drip. Good to shake it out in the bowl before resting it in its case. Sturdy, doesn't fall apart and doesn't feel weak and floppy like your standard dowel plunger. Only 3 stars because it works a little too well and potentially retains water.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down The Best
customer_reviews.text: I have four small children and get toilet clogs all the time. I've had to clear three this week already. I've owned several plungers and this is engineering perfection. This tool can form a seal on the modern elongated drain openings that every other plunger fails to do. It has excellent stroke volume, the seal to deliver it with force, and a T shaped handle that is perfect for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Loaded for Bear

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: Great suction that does the job. I couldn’t give it 5 stars though on “easy to clean” because there’s nothing easy about cleaning any plunger. Otherwise, it’s one of the best ones I’ve ever used. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Last plunger you will need!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several plungers that did not do the job. I am a lady and needed something that would be easier to unstop. The other plungers were annoying and would take forever to work. This one is the best. I have now replaced all of mine with these. (I have 3). This will be the last one you will need to buy because it works!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Hall

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after receiving our Korky toilet plunger, we had occasion to use it. It seated well, was comfortable to operate and did the job quickly and without mess. My only caveat is that the stand is open to the air and so does not block odors--not a big deal but a sealed container would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger

customer_reviews.title: Most effective plunger ever
customer_reviews.text: Order arrived next day, at least 5 days ahead of schedule!! This plunger is amazing as it covers the hole completely and has such force you could hear it continue working with very little water left in toilet! I've gone through so many types of plungers and this by far is the best one and super reasonable price. Bought this as a set with the holder and fits perfectly with only a slight pull to release from holder.
customer_reviews.author: mo3

customer_reviews.title: The t shaped handle come in very handy
customer_reviews.text: We live in a small, old town with many houses still with the original electric and plumbing. Herein lies the problem: we are not delicate poopers. I have two teenage boys (and myself) who use that plunger more than I’d like to admit... that being said, there’s a wonderful handle that helps you grab that plunger and plunge as if your life depends on it. It also works relatively quickly. 10 out of 10, would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: nonspecificgirl

customer_reviews.title: Really good plunger!
customer_reviews.text: We have toilets in which other plungers seem to make a larger mess, and less efficiency with plunging. Just as they advertised, I realized why my other standard plunger was relatively ineffective. We had the oval toilet drain (hole). Within the first day of receiving it I noticed that I could even plunge a clear toilet and force most of the water in the bowl back down the toilet! This plunger because even more effective when I had to use it with waste in the toilet! Great product. Granted it already proved itself in one day! By the way the "T" handle really helps!
customer_reviews.author: Vbb

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: It's really a pleasure when a purchase exceeds your expectations. This plunger is well designed and well built with quality components. It should give years of reliable service. I have both old and modern toilets in my house and this plunger fits both snuggly and gives a great burst of air on each plunge due to the extra large "beehive" plunger. The "T" handle is a nice plus, and the plunger does it's job without splashing water all over the place. Nicely done.
customer_reviews.author: Exile

customer_reviews.title: korky kUrky - it likes the U
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time before I reviewed so that I had at least several uses on it. There's no question how superior this is over the conventional plunger. One plunge is enough most of the time on my U shape bowl outlets. Pros: + Sucks up a serious amount of water - for more thrust + Soft rubber seals U shape bowl outlets better - no water splashing back up Cons: - Doesn't come with a case/house
customer_reviews.author: An Informed Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Plunger
customer_reviews.text: My husband says this plunger works awesome on our new Toto toilets. He wants me to buy more. We got the new toilets so we did not have to use a plunger all the time. The toilets we replaced were fairly new. We've got 3 kids who seem to have "issues" but with this plunger we are all set :-) I was a bit confused though as the actual plunger did not say it was the Korky 99-4A Max but the beehive plunger. So, Im not sure if they changed the name or what happened but it looks like the plunger in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: D B

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got this one.
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great for me so far. I was a bit worried that due to the height of the bellows it might collapse sideways when I pushed down on the handle but it does not - it's thick material and it takes little effort (and so far only one hit) to knock out a clog. The opening in the bottom of my toilet bowl is a bit too small so it seems to clogs easily; I get to use this about 3 times a week. My old plunger was an old-school standard plunger and it was difficult to use since it rarely wanted to get a good seal around the bowl drain opening. This one fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Robbins

customer_reviews.title: The only thing you need to know is that it works.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because the trusty old one did not fit the toilets in our new house. It took longer to get it out of the package and break down the box than it did to unclog the drain. I needed to pay attention to positioning it over the hole in the bottom of the toilet, but once I got it right it sealed perfectly. Three or four plunges later; job done.
customer_reviews.author: Strabot

customer_reviews.title: Better than drano or liquid plumr
customer_reviews.text: This thing has fixed every clog I've come across, including my shower. Do I deal with a lot of clogs? Yes. Is there a reason for that? No. I have short cut thinning hair, so it's not like I should have a lot of issues with clogging, but I do, and this slays them all.
customer_reviews.author: CB Adams

customer_reviews.title: Too hard.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber composition is too hard. When you press down it gives suddenly and splashes. When you lift, it separates form the drain instead of creating a vacuum. Then it will snap out and splash again.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Makes my plumber sad!
customer_reviews.text: I have one problematic toilet that was causing me to call the plumber every 3 months or so. I never imagined a plunger could make this much difference. I waited a year to write a review to really put this through its paces. It hasn’t failed me yet. As soon as I see slow draining, I flush again then plunge with the Beehive. It immediately loosens the blockage. I have not had to call the plumber once in this past year! I’ve saved so much money by not having to have the plumber come. This is definitely a go to item you’ll want in your home.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Barrone

customer_reviews.title: Plunger does the job
customer_reviews.text: T-handle makes this more comfortable to use body weight behind every plunge. As long as you get a good seal over the opening, you should have enough pressure to clear the blockage. Cleaning crap from inside the bellows is challenging because of the taper. Still a sturdy product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor M Chin

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I buy this plunger the first time around?
customer_reviews.text: I must say, this plunger falls under the category “wish I bought this first”. Our newer toilets have the oval shaped opening and all the other plungers were useless. Until this plunger came along. We now have one in each of our bathrooms and recommend that you stop reading and add it your cart. Seriously. THE only downside I would say is the holder that it comes with. Removing and replacing the plunger is not the easiest.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Williams

customer_reviews.title: I have found the plungers with the short cylinder on the bottom work better at least with my
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work as well as my prior plunger. Bought on recommendation from wire cutter but it did not live up to the hype. I have found the plungers with the short cylinder on the bottom work better at least with my toilets
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: It worked when no other plunger has.
customer_reviews.text: We tried multiple plungers on a problem toilet that clogs up freely. Normally the only thing that works is a snake. I bought this one without high expectations as part of a deal for a new snake I needed. It's a weird shaped flush area and we had tried two other non standard (fits all) plungers that had failed. So far, I've only tried it once, but it worked first time on a toilet that has never been successfully plunged in our 7 years in this house.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Graham III

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to store
customer_reviews.text: Works easily and effectively on all our toilets. The stand catches any drips. The only minor problem is that the plunger head is longer than the water level of my toilet, so I can't rinse it off easily in the bowl after using it, and have to hose it off in the tub.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Matelli

customer_reviews.title: the BEST one out there!!!
customer_reviews.text: This plunger REALLY WORKS!!! I ordered a bunch of them (the get bats out one, the neiko 60166A with something patented, etc.) because I really need one to work! I have 2 teenage boys and they are constantly plugging up the toilet! I tried all of the other one's I ordered that came at the same time, but once I used this one, It worked IMMEDIATELY!!!! I used the other ones so I'm not sure I can return them, but I ordered another one of these so I can be sure to have the good ones around!!! :O) I'm very happy with this product! I love the handle on it as well! Great idea!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Abiad

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing!!! I only had to plunge once to get the toilet unclogged. It fits the toilet (Kohler) perfectly. And it's very soft and easy to plunge.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Hallelujah
customer_reviews.text: Hallelujah. Finally, a toilet plunger that works for the modern low flow (rectangular) toilets. My only concern is the rod attached to the based of the rubber plunger doesn't seem too sturdy. I'm hoping it lasts for more than a year for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Wash_DC

customer_reviews.title: Good plunger, base could be easier to remove the plunger from
customer_reviews.text: The plunger is good. I've not had any problems with it and I like that it's universal and has enough give while being sturdy. I like the idea of the base/holder BUT it's so dang hard to get the plunger out of it I've stopped putting it in there. It's not worth the stress when you need the plunger NOW but you're battling with getting it out of the holder.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Works very well on Toto toilet
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to fit our toto toilet: Korky 95-4A Beehive Max Universal Toilet Plunger and Holder. The bottom of the toilet was not shaped like our previous toilet and the regular plunger would not form a seal and thus didn't work. This item works!
customer_reviews.author: JMcG

customer_reviews.title: Works....
customer_reviews.text: When my new Toto Aquia toilet wouldn't flush, I went into the basement to get my trusty plunger, only to be surprised that it wouldn't fit into the narrow opening of the toilet. We managed to get it working again, and I bought this Korky plunger for the next time. Last week we found it necessary to plunge again, and were pleased that this plunger fits, and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: V. Block

customer_reviews.title: thus producing good suction. Its rubber is strong but soft and ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well on the water-saving elongated Kohler toilet. Using the regular round plunger, it used to take over an hour to clear because there was not enough suction. Korky has an oval shape that fits the toilet, thus producing good suction. Its rubber is strong but soft and so it doesn't demand a lot of force on my part. It only takes a few easy plunges to unclog the toilet. However, Korky would not work well on the sink because of its shape. I still need the regular plunger for the sink if it works at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dongdong

customer_reviews.title: Works great but feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: This plunger does the job very well. The only issue I have is how the handle feels. I think it is too flimsy. I used a different brands with a very sturdy handle prior to this however the plunger part was lacking. The "T" grip is a great idea, but again needs to be a little more substance to it.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: This plunger is awesome. But, I should have bought Korky Beehive with Holder instead. Still VERY happy with this plunger.
customer_reviews.text: We have high efficiency toilets. Our old plunger (rotorooter) has been fine in the past, but one day it was not enough and this plunger was (with high efficiency toilet gel to help with the clog) the only plunger that worked. I strongly recommend this product. However since having bought this plunger I realized after the fact there is a separate korky product that includes the plunger housing ("holder"). I would suggest buying that if you will need something to hide the plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: This Plunger Works Fast!  Just Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: Oh Man! Why didn't I know about this plunger before! I used it for the fourth time this morning and it worked in under 30 seconds in opening a slow running toilet., just as it has the other three times. Just buy it. This is the top purchase I have made for convenience in the past two years.
customer_reviews.author: Eddi Haskell

product_meta.title: Korky 99-4A 99-1AM Beehive Max Universal Fits All Old and New Powerful Plunge-Easy Grip T-Handle-Made in USA Toilet Plunger, Black
product_meta.description:
Style:Non-Adjustable HandleProudly designed and made in the United States, the BEEHIVE Max Toilet Plunger is the first plunger designed to fit both old and new high efficiency toilets (HET). Toilet bowl drains have changed from round to oblong shaped outlets and standard plungers on the market cannot achieve a seal to effectively plunge. The t-handle and flexible, beehive shape head design, allow for an optimum grip and effective plunge in any toilet. Recommended by Kohler, the BEEHIVE Max Plunger fits Kohler, TOTO, American Standard, Mansfield and all other brands. As seen in This Old House - Top 100 Best New Home Products of 2014. The 99-4 includes: (1) T-Handle and (1) Plunger Head

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Proudly designed and made in the United States, the BEEHIVE Max Toilet Plunger is the first plunger designed to fit both old and new high efficiency toilets (HET). Toilet bowl drains have changed from round to oblong shaped outlets and standard plungers on the market cannot achieve a seal to effectively plunge. The t-handle and flexible, beehive shape head design, allow for an optimum grip and effective plunge in any toilet. Recommended by Kohler, the BEEHIVE Max Plunger fits Kohler, TOTO, American Standard, Mansfield and all other brands. As seen in This Old House - Top 100 Best New Home Products of 2014. The 99-4 includes: (1) T-Handle and (1) Plunger Head
feature_bullets: POWERFUL PLUNGE: This toilet plunger is the first plunger designed to fit old & new HET toilet bowls & the beehive shape allows for an effective plunge to unclog toilets. The t-handle provides an optimum grip.
UNCLOG TOILETS: Heavy duty bathroom plunger perfectly fits in toilet bowl outlets to create the perfect plunge for all toilet models & shapes. The beehive shape easily compresses with minimal effort.
THE UNVERSAL PLUNGER is made of durable rubber that doesn't mark up your toilet bowl. Unlike old standard toilet plungers, this plunger works with older low flow toilets & newer elongated designs.

WHY KORKY: Our high quality toilet products are universal & specific to both older & modern toilet models. Our repair parts are easy to install & made exclusively from long lasting chlorazone red rubber.

REPLACEMENT TOILET PARTS: Try Korky Toilet Repair because we continue to commit to designing toilet repair parts that are unviersal to fit the majority of toilets. Designed & manufactured in Wisconsin.
Fits all toilets including American Standard, Kohler and TOTO
Shape seals better, requiring less effort

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,139 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
